statement-noun.title: statement
statement-noun.definition: A formal declaration of facts or opinions, often made verbally or in writing to convey specific information or a point of view.
statement-noun.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone standing confidently, delivering a clear message that needs to be understood by others, or a piece of text that lays out facts without question.
statement-noun.exampleSentence: The politician's statement on the new policy was eagerly awaited by the public.

emphasis-noun.title: emphasis
emphasis-noun.definition: Special importance, value, or attention given to something, either through strong expression or focused concentration.
emphasis-noun.contextualMeaning: Picture a speaker raising their voice or pausing dramatically to draw attention to a key word, or text where certain words are bolded to make them stand out.
emphasis-noun.exampleSentence: The teacher placed great emphasis on understanding the main ideas of the lesson.

negative-adjective.title: negative
negative-adjective.definition: Expressing denial, disagreement, or refusal; also referring to something harmful, unpleasant, or undesirable.
negative-adjective.contextualMeaning: Visualize a frown, a shake of the head, or a dark cloud representing a bad outcome, illustrating something unfavorable or problematic.
negative-adjective.exampleSentence: Despite facing some negative feedback, the team remained positive about their project.

unspecified-adjective.title: unspecified
unspecified-adjective.definition: Not stated or identified precisely; left vague or indefinite.
unspecified-adjective.contextualMeaning: Imagine a calendar with no date circled, or a blurry map, conveying that details are unknown or not yet set.
unspecified-adjective.exampleSentence: The meeting was scheduled for an unspecified time next week, making it hard to plan.

various-adjective.title: various
various-adjective.definition: More than one; different from one another in kind or quality.
various-adjective.contextualMeaning: Picture a collection of many different objects, like a basket filled with apples, oranges, and bananas, representing a diverse range.
various-adjective.exampleSentence: The market offered various types of fresh produce, from leafy greens to sweet berries.

politeness-noun.title: politeness
politeness-noun.definition: The quality of being polite; behavior that shows respect, consideration, and good manners towards others.
politeness-noun.contextualMeaning: Visualize someone holding a door open, saying 'please' and 'thank you', or offering a helping hand, embodying respectful and thoughtful social conduct.
politeness-noun.exampleSentence: Her natural politeness made her popular with everyone she met.

politeness-adjective.title: polite
politeness-adjective.definition: Having or showing good manners and respect for other people.
politeness-adjective.contextualMeaning: See someone smiling kindly, speaking softly, and behaving respectfully, demonstrating proper social conduct and consideration.
politeness-adjective.exampleSentence: It's always important to be polite when speaking to strangers.

reputation-noun.title: reputation
reputation-noun.definition: The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something; how someone or something is generally regarded.
reputation-noun.contextualMeaning: Think of a person's good name being spoken highly of, or a company known for its excellent service; it's the general opinion people have.
reputation-noun.exampleSentence: The restaurant earned a strong reputation for its delicious food and friendly staff.

rude-adjective.title: rude
rude-adjective.definition: Impudent or discourteous, especially in a deliberate way; showing a lack of respect.
rude-adjective.contextualMeaning: Visualize someone cutting in line, speaking loudly over another, or making an impolite gesture, showing a clear disregard for others' feelings.
rude-adjective.exampleSentence: It's rude to interrupt someone while they are speaking.

well-known-adjective.title: well-known
well-known-adjective.definition: Known about by many people; famous or widely recognized.
well-known-adjective.contextualMeaning: Imagine a famous landmark or a celebrity whose face is instantly familiar to many, indicating widespread recognition.
well-known-adjective.exampleSentence: She is a well-known artist, and her paintings are displayed in galleries worldwide.

recently-adverb.title: recently
recently-adverb.definition: At a recent time; not long ago.
recently-adverb.contextualMeaning: Picture a clock's hands having just moved, or an event that happened just days or weeks ago, indicating a fresh memory.
recently-adverb.exampleSentence: I recently visited the new museum, and it was quite impressive.

innit-interjection.title: innit
innit-interjection.definition: (Slang) A colloquial short form of 'isn't it', used informally at the end of a statement to seek agreement or add emphasis.
innit-interjection.contextualMeaning: Hear someone casually ending their sentence with a rising tone, like a quick nod for confirmation, common in informal conversations.

thingy-noun.title: thingy
thingy-noun.definition: (Informal) Used to refer to something or someone whose name one cannot recall or does not know.
thingy-noun.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone gesturing vaguely at an object, trying to recall its name, or trying to name a person they recognize but whose name escapes them.
thingy-noun.exampleSentence: Could you pass me that thingy, the one for opening bottles?

recognised-verb.title: recognised
recognised-verb.definition: Identified someone or something from having encountered them or it before; acknowledged the existence, validity, or character of.
recognised-verb.contextualMeaning: See a familiar face light up in a crowd, indicating instant memory of a person, or spotting a known object among many others.
recognised-verb.exampleSentence: I immediately recognised her voice, even after many years.

brilliant-adjective.title: brilliant
brilliant-adjective.definition: Exceptional or outstanding; extremely clever or talented.
brilliant-adjective.contextualMeaning: Picture a bright light bulb above someone's head when they have an amazing idea, or a dazzling performance that leaves everyone in awe.
brilliant-adjective.exampleSentence: She came up with a brilliant solution to the complex problem.

poet-noun.title: poet
poet-noun.definition: A person who writes poems, a literary artist who uses language for its aesthetic and evocative qualities.
poet-noun.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone sitting with a pen and paper, crafting lines of verse, or reciting rhythmic words that paint vivid images in the mind.
poet-noun.exampleSentence: The ancient poet wrote epic tales of heroes and gods.

impolite-adjective.title: impolite
impolite-adjective.definition: Not having or showing good manners; rude.
impolite-adjective.contextualMeaning: See someone interrupting rudely, speaking with a harsh tone, or ignoring another person, showing a clear lack of respect.
impolite-adjective.exampleSentence: It was very impolite of him to walk away while I was still talking.

perceived-verb.title: perceived
perceived-verb.definition: Became aware or conscious of something; interpreted or regarded something in a particular way.
perceived-verb.contextualMeaning: Picture someone's eyes opening wide as they suddenly understand something, or their expression changing as they grasp the hidden meaning behind words.
perceived-verb.exampleSentence: The audience perceived the subtle humor in the play.

conventional-adjective.title: conventional
conventional-adjective.definition: Based on or in accordance with what is generally done or believed; widely accepted and standard.
conventional-adjective.contextualMeaning: Imagine a straight line, a standard handshake, or traditional clothing, representing actions or items that follow established norms and expectations.
conventional-adjective.exampleSentence: The artist avoided conventional styles, choosing instead to experiment with new forms.

interpreted-verb.title: interpreted
interpreted-verb.definition: Explained the meaning of (information, words, or actions); understood or construed in a particular way.
interpreted-verb.contextualMeaning: See someone translating a foreign language, or figuring out the hidden message in a text, showing the process of understanding meaning.
interpreted-verb.exampleSentence: Her silence was interpreted as a sign of disagreement.

non-threatening-adjective.title: non-threatening
non-threatening-adjective.definition: Not causing any feeling of being in danger or under attack; not appearing to pose a threat.
non-threatening-adjective.contextualMeaning: Picture a calm expression, open hands, or soft body language, showing that there is no danger or intent to harm.
non-threatening-adjective.exampleSentence: The police officer's calm tone was non-threatening, helping to de-escalate the situation.

aggressive-adjective.title: aggressive
aggressive-adjective.definition: Ready or likely to attack or confront; behaving in a forceful and often hostile way.
aggressive-adjective.contextualMeaning: Visualize someone with a clenched fist, a raised voice, or a challenging stance, indicating a readiness for conflict or confrontation.
aggressive-adjective.exampleSentence: The dog's aggressive barking scared away the mail carrier.

offensive-adjective.title: offensive
offensive-adjective.definition: Causing annoyance, resentment, or anger; displeasing or insulting.
offensive-adjective.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone grimacing at a bad smell, or reacting with shock and anger to a harsh comment, showing something that causes strong negative feelings.
offensive-adjective.exampleSentence: His comments were highly offensive to many members of the audience.

benefits-noun.title: benefits
benefits-noun.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something; something that promotes well-being or is helpful.
benefits-noun.contextualMeaning: Picture someone smiling as they receive a reward, or seeing positive results from an effort, representing the good things that come from an action.
benefits-noun.exampleSentence: The new fitness program offers numerous health benefits.

repeatedly-adverb.title: repeatedly
repeatedly-adverb.contextualMeaning: Visualize a bouncing ball hitting the ground over and over, or someone trying the same action multiple times, indicating constant recurrence.
repeatedly-adverb.exampleSentence: She repeatedly called his name, but he didn't seem to hear.

nursery-noun.title: nursery
nursery-noun.definition: A room or area set aside for young children; often, a facility that cares for children typically below school age.
nursery-noun.contextualMeaning: Imagine a colorful room filled with toys, small chairs, and playing children, a safe and bright space designed for early childhood care.
nursery-noun.exampleSentence: My little sister attends a nursery school every morning.

refused-verb.title: refused
refused-verb.definition: Indicated that one is unwilling to do something requested or accept something offered.
refused-verb.contextualMeaning: Picture someone shaking their head firmly, crossing their arms, or turning away, clearly showing an unwillingness to agree or comply.
refused-verb.exampleSentence: He refused to apologize, despite knowing he was in the wrong.

disappointed-adjective.title: disappointed
disappointed-adjective.definition: Sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes or expectations.
disappointed-adjective.contextualMeaning: See a drooping face, slouched shoulders, or a look of sadness after something didn't go as planned, showing a sense of let-down.
disappointed-adjective.exampleSentence: She was deeply disappointed when her favorite team lost the championship.

mention-verb.title: mention
mention-verb.definition: Refer to something briefly without going into great detail; to speak or write about something casually.
mention-verb.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone quickly pointing out a detail in passing, or briefly bringing up a topic without dwelling on it, signifying a quick reference.
mention-verb.exampleSentence: He forgot to mention that he would be late for dinner.

kitchen-noun.title: kitchen
kitchen-noun.definition: A room or area where food is prepared, cooked, and often eaten.
kitchen-noun.contextualMeaning: Picture a bustling space filled with the smells of cooking, sounds of pots and pans, and people working around a stove and counter, central to food preparation.
kitchen-noun.exampleSentence: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.

recap-verb.title: recap
recap-verb.definition: To summarize the main points of something; to reiterate briefly.
recap-verb.contextualMeaning: Imagine someone quickly going over a checklist at the end of a meeting, or reviewing notes to remember key information, providing a brief summary.
recap-verb.exampleSentence: Let me recap the main decisions we made today.

learnt-verb.title: learnt
learnt-verb.definition: Gained knowledge or skill by study, experience, or being taught.
learnt-verb.contextualMeaning: See a student's eyes lighting up as they grasp a new concept, or someone practicing a skill until they master it, showing the process of acquiring knowledge.
learnt-verb.exampleSentence: From her travels, she learnt a lot about different cultures.

worksheet-noun.title: worksheet
worksheet-noun.definition: A piece of paper or document with questions and exercises for students to complete.
worksheet-noun.contextualMeaning: Picture a page with empty lines and questions, ready for a student to fill in answers during a lesson or for homework.
worksheet-noun.exampleSentence: The teacher handed out a worksheet for the math practice.

quiz-noun.title: quiz
quiz-noun.definition: A short test of knowledge, often informal.
quiz-noun.contextualMeaning: Imagine a quick pop-up on a screen asking a few questions, or a friendly competition where people test their knowledge on a specific topic.
quiz-noun.exampleSentence: We had a short quiz on history at the end of the class.

available-adjective.title: available
available-adjective.definition: Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
available-adjective.contextualMeaning: See an item sitting on a shelf, ready to be picked up, or a person ready and free to help, indicating readiness for use or access.
available-adjective.exampleSentence: The book you requested is now available at the library.
